subject: Re: [junit] How to test threaded method?
msgSnippet: ... From: Kris Henderson  ... Store the events in a queue from Doug Lea s util.concurrent library:
messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: "Kris Henderson" <khenderson@...>
> I have a method that when called creates a thread and does all its work
> in the new thread. It looks kind of like this:
>
> public void doSomething()
> {
> Thread requestThread = new Thread()
> {
> public void run()
> {
> fireStartEvent();
>
> //do some stuff that takes a long time
>
> fireDoneEvent();
> }
> };
> requestThread.start();
> }
>
> I would like to test this method to make sure it sends the correct
> events in the correct order and that the EventObject contains the
> correct data.
>
Store the events in a queue from Doug Lea's util.concurrent library:
http://gee.cs.oswego.edu/dl/classes/EDU/oswego/cs/dl/util/concurrent/intro.html.
Read them off the queue in your main test thread and do your asserts.

- Neil Swingler
